**The Wondrous Perfection Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Celestial Diagrams and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny**

**Scripture Title:** *The Wondrous Perfection Highest Clarity Scripture of the Heavenly Pass, Three Diagrams, and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Highest Clarity tradition. Originally one scroll, later divided into two. Source text: *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

**The Wondrous Perfection Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Celestial Diagrams and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny, Volume One**

**The Supreme Method for Transcending Death, Preserving Life, and Securing Immortality**

The Heavenly Pass is the Gate of Life of the Nine Heavens, governing the southeast corner of the Nine Heavens. It is also called the Celestial Diagram or the Heavenly Pass, hence the Three Passes. It is the path traversed by the host of perfected beings, the course tread by divine immortals, and the way by which scholars ascend. It lies five thousand *li* from the Golden Portal and seven thousand *li* from the Upper Palace of Jade Clarity. Once one has passed through the Three Passes, one may ascend to the Golden Portal and wander in the feasts of Jade Clarity.

The First Heavenly Pass stands atop a nine-tiered jade terrace, rising twelve hundred *zhang* above the earth. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass, while three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand vigil at the gates. The Jade Dawn Overseer of the Great Void, whose name is Void Supreme Clarity, resides upon the jade terrace. Flying clouds and flowing auroras flank his chamber, while the mysterious radiance of sun and moon illumines Jade Clarity. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, presiding over the entry and exit of ascending immortals and the opening of the pass.

The Second Heavenly Pass stands atop a six-tiered jade terrace, nine hundred *zhang* in height. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass, while three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand guard at either side of the gate. The Supreme Overseer of Perfected Jade, whose name is Bright Elder, is enthroned upon the jade terrace. Crimson clouds and purple canopies shroud his chamber, while the mysterious light of sun and moon shines between them. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, overseeing the passage of the host of perfected beings as they wander and feast.

The Third Heavenly Pass stands atop a three-tiered jade terrace, six hundred *zhang* in height. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass, while three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand guard at either side. The Supreme Emperor’s Overseer of Perfected Jade, whose name is Heavenly Eternal Life, is enthroned upon the jade terrace. Dark clouds veil its summit, while ethereal mists perfume its courtyard. A light of self-illumination gleams upon his form. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, presiding over the celestial host of perfected beings, the earthly multitude of living beings, and the registers and records that govern their passage.

Those who receive the Dao of inscribing their names upon golden tablets and jade slips must cultivate the method of passing through the Heavenly Pass. At dawn and dusk, one should enter the chamber, burn incense, and strike the teeth twelve times. Facing east, bow in reverence to the four directions, and visualize the boundary of the Nine Heavens, clearly perceiving the Three Passes below in vivid detail. When the vision is complete, next visualize the Seven Stars above the heavens, revolving with the celestial motion. Envision your body upon the stars of the Heavenly Pass, the Seven Stars carrying you to the base of the jade terrace of the Heavenly Pass. There, present a jade slip and announce your name to the Jade Dawn Overseer of the Great Void. See the overseer inscribe your name upon the jade register, permitting your passage to the base of the Heavenly Pass.

Next, visualize your body returning to the Seven Stars, which carry you to the base of the jade terrace of the Heavenly Pass. Present another jade slip and announce your name before the Supreme Overseer of Perfected Jade. See the overseer inscribe your name upon the jade register, permitting your passage to the base of the Heavenly Pass.

Then, visualize your body returning once more to the Seven Stars, which carry you to the base of the jade terrace of the Heavenly Pass. Present another jade slip and announce your name before the Supreme Emperor’s Overseer of Perfected Jade. See the overseer inscribe your name upon the jade register, permitting your passage to the Golden Portal beneath the Palace of Jade Clarity.

Next, visualize the Seven Stars receding, your body suspended in the Void of Emptiness, adrift in the primordial chaos, with nothing to rely upon or perceive. After a moment, you will find yourself above the Golden Gate of the Golden Portal and Jade Capital. Present a golden slip, and see the Four Pole Perfected Ones receive it upon a jade table, entering to announce it before the Lord Emperor of the Golden Portal. The Four Pole Perfected Ones will report and ascend with you to the summit of Jade Clarity.

Next, visualize the summit of Jade Clarity, where the Four Poles stretch boundlessly, with only verdant *qi* billowing thickly. Above, there is no heaven; below, no earth. Only at the center do four golden gates open in all directions, within which stand palaces of jasper and jade trees, golden branches flourishing on either side. Mighty dragons and beasts roam and play upon their peaks. Envision yourself wandering among them for a long while, until you feel as though awakening from sleep, your body returning to its resting state. Within, you will feel a vague, ethereal sensation, as though treading upon emptiness. When the vision of your journey is complete, strike the teeth sixteen times and recite the incantation while gazing upward:

*"The Three Flowers’ precious radiance,
The Jade Capital opens in clarity.
Mysterious splendor unfolds,
Illumining the formless overseer.
Golden tablets record the script,
Inscribing names upon jade.
Brightly beholding the Nine Heavens,
Ascending to sport in the Three Clarities.
The Three Diagrams of the Heavenly Pass,
Returning to ascend the Purple Court.
Receiving titles in the Golden Portal,
Eastern Florescence records life.
Attaining the Eight Effulgences,
Driving the flying plow."*

When finished, swallow the *qi* nine times and cease.

Those who study the Dao yet do not know the method of passing through the Heavenly Pass or the way of presenting tablets and inscribing names will never achieve success. The Three Passes govern all the heavens and earths, the flying immortals, and the registers of beginning scholars—none may bypass the Three Passes.

If a diligent student of the Dao can ensure their jade name is recorded in the Nine Heavens and the Three Passes, and that the Jade Dawn of the Three Passes presents it to the Palace of the Supreme and the Supreme Emperor, then the Lord Emperor will dispatch twelve jade lads and twelve jade maidens to attend and protect them.

This is the Supreme Emperor’s Upper Scripture, transmitted to the Lord Emperor of Heaven. The Lord Emperor of Heaven transmitted it to the Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Pole, who transmitted it to the Lord Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity. The Lord Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity transmitted it to the Lord Emperor of the Golden Portal, who entrusted it to the Prime Minister, the Azure Lad, to teach future scholars destined to become perfected beings.

According to the Mysterious Statutes, this may be transmitted thrice within seven hundred years. The Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Pole commands ninety Western Florescence Jade Maidens to guard within the Southern Pole’s Purple Chamber.

The Azure Lad states: Those whose bone and countenance accord with the Mysterious may behold this Dao, learn the method of submitting memorial tablets, and thereby become perfected beings. Yet the statutes are exceedingly weighty—this must not be lightly divulged. Among the multitudes of scholars, how few encounter the true! Thus the Central Yellow and Old Lord declared: One who beholds the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Perfected Scripture* shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight. Yet some who cultivate it for years achieve no success and claim the scripture is not true. This is solely because their names are not recorded on the Golden Tablet in the Eastern Florescence or the Jade Slip in the Golden Portal; the true spirits do not descend for them, and they are instead assailed by celestial demons, resulting in no response. Though they may obtain myriad divine scriptures, they will still not succeed.

If one first submits a Golden Tablet to the Azure Palace and presents a Jade Slip to the Imperial Sovereign, receiving the attendance of the Golden Dawn Jade Lads and Western Florescence Jade Maidens to guard the numinous text, and if this is proclaimed throughout the heavens and earth, with the Three Realms extolling its virtue and chanting its verses ten thousand times—how could one fail to evoke the response of jade chariots and purple carriages?

**Memorial for Submitting Jade Slips at the Three Passes of Heaven**
Presented at the Jade Terrace of the Heavenly Pass, beneath the supervision of the Great Void Jade Dawn Inspector:
[Name], of [prefecture, county, village], male/female, born in the year of [zodiac], aged [years], born in the [month], styled [courtesy name].

Presented at the Jade Terrace of the Heavenly Chart, beneath the supervision of the Supreme Perfected Jade Gentleman Inspector:
[Name], of [prefecture, county, village], male/female, born in the year of [zodiac], aged [years], born in the [month], styled [courtesy name].

Presented at the Jade Terrace of the Heavenly Pass, beneath the supervision of the Supreme Emperor’s Perfected Jade Controller:
[Name], of [prefecture, county, village], male/female, born in the year of [zodiac], aged [years], born in the [month], styled [courtesy name].

The above three Jade Slips shall each be one foot and six inches in length.

**Memorial for Submitting a Jade Slip at the Golden Pass**
Presented before the Golden Portal Emperor Lord:
[Name], of [prefecture, county, village], male/female, born in the year of [zodiac], aged [years], born in the [month], styled [courtesy name].

The above Jade Slip shall be one foot and six inches in length.

The Azure Lad states: If one lacks a Golden Tablet, silver or wood may suffice; if one lacks a Jade Slip, paulownia wood may suffice—so long as it is refined and flawless, with unbroken grain.

The Azure Lad further states: When submitting the Jade Slips at the Heavenly Pass, Heavenly Chart, and Heavenly Pass, ascend the path to the Azure Palace and the Golden Portal of the Jade Clarity. Write the Jade Slip in azure ink, first enter the chamber and strike the teeth twelve times, then face east to read the slip. After completing the visualization practice, place the slip in a cloud-brocade pouch, burn incense beside it, and never expose it lightly. This is the supreme title of the highest perfected beings, the numinous scripture of the Jade Emperor.

If one’s golden name and jade characters are inscribed in reverse in the Azure Palace and one obtains this Dao, one must follow the statutes of the Supreme Perfected: prepare one Golden Tablet and one Jade Slip, each one foot and two inches long, two inches and four parts wide, along with one golden fish and one jade dragon. Offer one hundred feet of purple silk and thirty feet of azure damask as the covenant of the Supreme Perfected, presenting them to one’s scripture-holding master. The master faces east, the recipient faces north, and they swear an oath before the Northern Emperor and their seven ancestors, pledging not to divulge the secret. According to the Mysterious Statutes, this may be transmitted thrice within seven hundred years. If transmitted to an unworthy recipient, the seven mysteries and nine ancestors shall be eternally consigned to ghostly servitude, their bodies perishing in the Nine Springs, never to attain immortality.

Devoted scholars and those who aspire to immortality must adhere to the statutes and cultivate in accordance with the text. This precious scripture is treasured by the Supreme Emperor Lord, who transmitted it to the Heavenly Emperor Lord. The Heavenly Emperor Lord transmitted it to the Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Pole, who transmitted it to the Supreme Emperor Lord of the Supreme Tenuity. The Supreme Emperor Lord of the Supreme Tenuity transmitted it to the Sage Lord of the Golden Portal, who entrusted it to the Prime Minister, the Azure Lad, to teach those destined to become immortals. Thus, it is transmitted once every seven hundred years. The Supreme Primordial Lord commands thirty-six Western Florescence Jade Maidens to safeguard the numinous text within the Southern Pole’s Purple Chamber.

The Heavenly Emperor Lord states: This scripture governs the writings of the Nine Heavens and the hidden texts of the Eight Assemblies, surpassing all other Daoist teachings and excelling beyond the jade scriptures. Thus, the Central Yellow and Old Lord concealed the *Thirty-Nine Chapters*, and the Supreme Emperor Lord treasured the *Seven Primes’ Transference*. Though the Three Vehicles each display their wonders, their practical application does not align.

Perfected beings merely know how to tread the celestial net and gaze upward at the Five Dawns, swallowing qi and imbibing mist, chewing the solar root, absorbing the mysterious infusion of flowing essence, and returning to vast whiteness to prolong their years. Yet they do not comprehend the transference of the Seven Stars, the opening and closing of the Heavenly Pass, the revolving of the Nine Qi for self-contemplation, or the preservation of the Seven Essences in the Muddy Pellet. Those who practice this Dao shall ride upon clouds of emerald carriages, and thus the Supreme Emperor is honored as the utmost in supremacy.

The Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Pole states: From refining and gathering the Mysterious Radiance, exhaling and inhaling the flowing mist, consolidating the hun and po, securing essence and preserving spirit, to wielding the Purple Transcendence and the Scorching Radiance, ringing the Golden Fire Bell, binding the luminous brilliance and galloping to the moon, commanding ten thousand transformations of the solar effulgence, the Nine Perfected and Eight Daoists donning the solar and lunar imperial splendor, wearing jade pendants and golden girdles, and visualizing the true forms of the Two Effulgences—such practices number over three hundred. Yet even if one causes the Mysterious Radiance to ascend and infuse, reposing in the numinous palace, one has still not received the transference of the Seven Stars, the pivotal mechanism of heaven, nor traversed the Twenty-Eight Constellations, revolved the two luminaries of sun and moon, drawn from the Five Dawns for combined use, or resolved the union and separation in the bedchamber. Then the heavens shall descend purple mist, and the Emperor shall dispatch the Golden Dawn Lads.

If one can endure hardship, accumulate devotion, and resonate with the Mysterious Palace, within seven years one may ride the emerald shafts of the Three Pure Ones’ flying carriage, ascending to the Imperial Dawn—truly subtle and wondrous, an unfathomable transformation!

The Supreme Emperor Lord of the Supreme Tenuity states: Perfected beings merely know how to tread the celestial net and traverse the Seven Primes, yet they do not comprehend the transference of the Seven Stars or the opening of the Heavenly Pass. They do not revolve the Dipper’s net to shield the body, nor circulate the Seven Degrees to ensure longevity. They do not depart from the northeastern "Gate of Death" nor unite with the southwestern "Gate of Life." Practicing this for fourteen years, one shall evoke the descent of the jade chariot and the flying carriage of cinnabar mist, ascending in broad daylight to the Golden Portal’s palace.

The Golden Portal Sage Lord states: The Dao of the Heavenly Pass is easy to unfold yet difficult to comprehend; the transference of the Seven Primes is hard to perceive yet easy to practice. The separation and union of the Two Symbols are the source of life and death. Humans receive qi and possess thirteen modes of life; when fate reaches its end, they return to thirteen modes of death. Thus, the Heavenly Pass serves as the pivot of separation and union, while the Seven Primes are the root of life and death. Those who cultivate lofty practices and seek immortality with sincere devotion, yet do not know how to seal the death-qi at the Ghost Gate, transfer the life-qi through the Human Gate, revolve the Seven Stars to the northeast, or unfold the Heavenly Pass to the southwest, shall not escape mortality—attaining Perfection will be exceedingly difficult. If one bears a golden name in the Eastern Florescence and a jade title in the Upper Clarity, having beheld this Dao, then the root of deathlessness shall be established. Practicing this for seven years, one shall hold the rank of a named immortal, ascend in a flying carriage of emerald shafts, the body of a cinnabar youth, and mount the Mysterious Palace.

The Most Exalted Minister, the Azure Lad Lord, states: The turning mechanism revolves through Heaven and Earth, the Mysterious Dipper governs the Eight Gates, its flowing radiance illumines the Nine Empyreans, the celestial might shakes the Ten Directions. The celestial patterns are arrayed upon the Heavenly Chart, life and death are encompassed within the Seven Primes. The Five Separations are firmly established to suppress death, while the Six Harmonies are gathered for self-protection. If one can ride the High Perfected to seek deliverance, seal the Ghost Gate at the Heavenly Pass, ingest the Nine Essences to inwardly illuminate, and visualize the Mysterious Dipper’s subtle glow, one shall summon the flying carriage of cinnabar mist and the clouds of the Three Pure Ones, soaring through the void to ascend to the Empyrean Dawn. Those who cultivate the Dao of transposing the Seven Stars shall summon the Nine Lords of the Jade Emperor; with the inner illumination of Mysterious Essence, they sever the root of death. One must dwell in a secluded chamber with a tranquil mind, undisturbed by worldly dust, standing alone to face the light, gazing upon the Empyrean Dawn. Burn incense to left and right, diffuse mist in the courtyard of rosy clouds, concentrate the mind with earnest devotion, and remain awake on this day. After seven years of such practice, the jade carriage with its flying canopy and cinnabar shafts shall descend to welcome the adept’s body, ascending through the Heavenly Pass to seal the path of death in the northeast and inscribe the immortal’s name in the Southern Transcendence—this is the Dao most difficult to attain, yet the Perfected most readily descend.

Those who possess a golden register and jade name may unfold this Dao. One should choose the days of the Six Celestial Convergences: *renyin*, *bingyin*, *jiazi*, *jiawu*, *xinwei*, and *xinchou*, for these are the times when the Most High aligns with the harmonious moments. On these days, the Jade Emperor routinely dispatches the Jade Lads of the Attendant Immortals to review and confirm the golden registers and jade names of the Eastern Florescence and Azure Palace, recording those who study the immortal’s path. On such days, if one’s diligent aspiration ascends to move the Jade Emperor, he shall command the Northern Emperor of Fengdu’s Six Palaces to sever the root of death’s register, inscribe the record of life at the Human Gate, transpose the Seven Stars to the Ghost Gate, transfer the Mysterious Pivot, and unfold the Heavenly Pass.

Whenever practicing purification and fasting, one must earnestly visualize and focus inwardly. Close the eyes and internally store the vision, then knock the teeth thirty-six times. Visualize the First Celestial Star, the Supreme August Mysterious Pivot of Yang Brightness, the Celestial Pivot Hun Spirit, the Nine Lords of the Upper Mysterious, clad in flying cloud brocade skirts, crowned with the coronet of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Then recite the incantation:

*"Supreme August Mysterious Pivot of Yang Brightness, Celestial Pivot Hun Spirit, Nine Perfected Lords of the Upper Mysterious, blending and transforming as one spirit—may you sever my path of death at the Ghost Gate, transfer the record of life to the Southern Pavilion, remove the Seven Mysteries from the Three Paths, and rebirth me to become an immortal. Revolve the Seven Essences to grant me mysterious shade, and deliver my form through the Heavenly Pass."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Second Primordial Star, the Northern Womb Yin Essence, the Celestial Chariot Hun Spirit, the Nine Jade Lords of the Upper Mystery, all clad in yellow brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Swallow qi and recite the incantation:

*"Northern Womb Yin Essence, Celestial Chariot Hun Spirit, Nine Jade Lords of the Upper Mystery, blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you erase my yang transgressions in the Great Yin, transfer yin qi to the Great Yang, transpose the Seven Primes to sever death, and unfold the Six Harmonies at the Heavenly Pass. Deliver my seven ancestors from the Three Paths, and grant me rebirth in the Southern Pavilion."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Third True Star, the Nine Ultimates of the Upper Perfected, the Lady of the Upper Primordial, the Celestial Mechanism Po Essence, the Nine Pure Lords of the Upper Simplicity, all clad in azure brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Swallow qi and recite the incantation:

*"Nine Ultimates of the Upper Perfected, Lady of the Upper Primordial, Celestial Mechanism Po Essence, Nine Pure Lords of the Upper Simplicity, blending and transforming as one spirit—may you unfold and dissolve the roots of karmic opposition, sever the source of the deathly path. Grant me eyes that see clearly and penetrate the boundless, with Mysterious Perfection pouring down and essence irrigating my body. May I grasp the August Chief Star, tread the Seven Primes, ride the luminous void, and soar alongside Heaven."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Fourth Pivot Star, the Mysterious Mechanism of Profound Darkness, the Celestial Balance Hun Essence, the Nine Void Lords of the Upper Mystery, all clad in purple brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Recite the incantation:

*"Mysterious Mechanism of Profound Darkness, Celestial Balance Hun Essence, Nine Void Lords of the Upper Mystery, blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you transpose the Seven Stars, fill and seal the Ghost Gate, sever the death-qi, and unfold the radiant Heavenly Pass. Revolve the Northern Dipper at the Mysterious Pivot, transfer the life-qi to the Western Kun, depart from the Northern Emperor of Fengdu, and inscribe my name in the Southern Pavilion."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Fifth Principal Star, the Celestial Balance of Cinnabar Origin, the Jade Balance Hun Terrace, the Nine August Lords of the Upper Mystery, all clad in cinnabar brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Recite the incantation:

*"Celestial Balance of Cinnabar Origin, Jade Balance Hun Spirit, Nine August Lords of the Upper Mystery, blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you descend the Seven Essences upon me, pour them into my body, revolve the Four to become Three, and activate the Seven Primes. Seal the Ghost Gate in the northeast, receive the life palace of the Nine Mysteries, inscribe my name in the Eastern Florescence, and allow me to serve the Jade Dawn."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times. With unwavering practice, one shall summon the guests of the Jade Emperor. The Emperor shall descend upon a thoroughfare of purple clouds, accompanied by twelve Western Florescence Jade Maidens and twelve Golden Dawn Jade Lads to attend and guard the adept’s body.

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times. Next, visualize the Sixth Register Star, the Life-Mechanism of the Northern Ultimate, the Radiant Yang Hun-Spirit Terrace, the Nine Lords of the Upper Cinnabar and Void. Clad in crimson brocade flying skirts and crowned with the Dark Dawn’s coronet, they descend from the Dark Dipper into one’s body. Recite the incantation:

*"Life-Mechanism of the Northern Ultimate, Radiant Yang Hun-Spirit Terrace, Upper Cinnabar and Void Nine Lords—blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you open for me the Heavenly One’s Three Charts of the Mystic Pass above, revolve the Six Palaces of Fengdu below, and govern the yin officials. Sever the roots of nine deaths, return the Three to the Four, and inscribe my name in the Seven Primes. May I preserve eternity and share the Dipper’s lifespan."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times. Next, visualize the Seventh Barrier Star, the Dark Yang Celestial Barrier, the Shaking Brilliance of the Great Luminous Supreme Jade Emperor Dao Lord. Clad in cinnabar brocade flying gauze skirts and crowned with the Dark Dawn’s coronet, they descend from the Dark Dipper into one’s body. Recite the incantation:

*"Dark Yang Celestial Barrier, Shaking Brilliance of the Great Luminous Supreme Jade Emperor Dao Lord—blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you summon for me the Nine Perfected Lords of the Imperial Dawn above. Merge the Nine Yin, revolve the Celestial Gate, and release my Seven Mysteries’ ancestors. Grant me roaming through the Dark Clouds, sever my Northern Yin’s roots of death, and inscribe my name in the Eastern Florescence’s Jade Register."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times. Upon completing the visualization of the Seven Primes, knock the teeth twelve times. With eyes closed, envision the seven stars of the Northern Dipper shining brilliantly, illuminating the north. The Dark Essence reflects inwardly, descending to cover one’s body. The Perfected Lords within the Dipper undergo hun-tun transformations, assuming no fixed form. Together, they ride clouds of green mist to welcome the adept’s body, ascending into the midst of the Seven Stars.

One perceives oneself at the center of the Dipper, beneath the Flourishing Canopy. Radiant essence blazes, encircling the body like a crown, revolving with the Dipper as a wheel turns. In an instant, the Celestial Barrier opens. The Seven Stars and Nine Lords each bestow the talismans of the Seven Primes’ Barrier-Opening, enabling control over the Six Palaces of the Northern Emperor and severing the roots of death-qi.

Upon receiving the talismans, one revolves and returns to the original essence, dwelling once more within the Dipper. The seven talismans blaze like fiery essence, propelling the adept downward. Suddenly treading the void, in the blink of an eye, one rests in the grove of repose. Knock the teeth thirty-six times and, lifting the head, recite the incantation:

*"Dark Radiance illumines essence, flowing light takes lightning’s form. Shedding mist, I vanish and transform, ascending to the Seven Stars. The Turning Mechanism tightens its reins, swift as startled lightning. The Heavenly One opens the Barrier, conveying me to life’s inscription. The Northern Emperor’s yin palaces sever my death-name. If not conveyed, if not severed, I turn toward the Seven Essences. I bear the Seven Primes, flowing gold and fiery bells. The Barrier-Opening’s celestial mechanism floods the Eight Darknesses. I command the Six Jia, dispatch the Six Ding. Heaven sends down Dark Mist, the Emperor grants divine soldiers. I beseech the Eastern Florescence to record my jade name. Soaring through the void, I ascend to the Jade Purity."*

Then, swallow qi thirty-six times and cease.

This concludes the Dao of opening the Celestial Barrier, severing the roots of death, and blending myriad transformations. Practicing this for seven years and bearing the Seven Primes’ Barrier-Opening will summon green-mist chariots to welcome the adept’s body. This method must be secretly cultivated; do not transmit it lightly.

*The Upper Scroll of the* Wondrous True Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Charts of Opening Heaven and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny *#1: "Celestial Barrier" (originally miswritten as "Opening Heaven").*

*The Lower Scroll of the* Wondrous True Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Charts of Opening Heaven and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny.

**The Talismans of the Seven Primes’ Barrier-Opening of the Emperor Lord**
- Right: Orpiment inscribed on fresh green silk.
- Right: Malachite inscribed in crimson.
- Right: Vermilion inscribed on blue-green silk (alternatively, yellow on plain silk).
- Right: Orpiment inscribed on white silk.
- Right: Orpiment inscribed on fresh purple silk (alternatively, black on plain silk).
- Right: Black inscribed on yellow silk.
- Right: Vermilion inscribed on blue-green silk.

The inner talismans of the Seven Primes’ Barrier-Opening were bestowed by the Emperor Lord upon the Heavenly Emperor Lord, who transmitted them to the Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Ultimate. The Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Ultimate transmitted them to the Heavenly Emperor Lord of the Grand Tenuity, who passed them to the Lord of the Golden Watchtower. The Lord of the Golden Watchtower entrusted them to the Azure Lad of the Upper Minister, who conferred them upon those destined for immortality.

According to the *Scripture of the Four Poles’ Luminous Regulations*, these talismans emerge once every seven hundred years. The method of transmission requires the disciple to observe a seven-day fast, offering thirty-one feet of blue-threaded silk, seventy feet of blue silk, ninety feet of phoenix-patterned gauze, seven pairs of gold buttons, one pair each of gold fish and jade dragons as tokens of the oath. To receive the scripture without such tokens is to treat the celestial treasure lightly; to transmit it without upholding the oath is to leak the Dao of Heaven. Sages value the Dao and disdain wealth, thus transmitting it only with tokens. Those who vex over wealth while seeking the Dao will find the Dao ever distant. Even if one glimpses the treasure text amid such leaks, the body will perish among the ghost officials, calamity extending to the Seven Mysteries—no benefit shall arise from such attainment.

If one possesses sincere devotion, an empty and earnest heart, and petitions the Jade Emperor to inscribe their name in the Eastern Florescence, dwelling in secluded peaks and distancing oneself from the human realm, sacrificing one’s own clothing and sustenance—only then may the scripture be transmitted.

Scholars who study yet remain ignorant of Heaven’s Celestial Barrier and Earth’s Fengdu—where the Barrier governs spirits and Fengdu commands ghosts—fail to grasp that these two Emperors preside over life and death, bound by the Dipper’s pivotal mechanism. Thus, the Seven Stars’ transference severs the Six Palaces’ names, while the Celestial Barrier records the register of immortals. The Dark Dipper corresponds to the Flourishing Canopy, and the Seven Primes bestow the Barrier-Opening. The path to immortality lies near at hand.

The Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Ultimate declared: "Those with aspiration are all illumined in heart by the Seven Stars and Nine Emperors. Through ardent seeking and苦念, one naturally attains this scripture. Cultivating it for seven years leads to ascending at dawn. Even if one merely venerates this scripture without visualization, burning incense to its left and right, the essence of the Seven Stars will still constantly illumine the chamber, and the officials of Fengdu will not dare approach the body."

Once the ritual of transference through the Seven Stars is complete, next visualize and invoke the Two August Stars. Sit upright facing east, and strike the teeth thirty-six times. Visualize the Two August Stars—the Nine Exalted Lords of the Eightfold Radiance of the Most High Jade Emperor, and the Lords of the Seven Primes of the Supreme Subtlety and the Jade Emperor of the Grand Tenuity—all clad in skirts of purple brocade woven with flying clouds, crowned with the coronets of the Dark Dawn. Descending from the Dark Dipper, they enter your body. Recite the incantation:

Through the Seven Stars’ translocation and the cultivation of its Way, he attained the rank of Perfected.

Since the time when those without jade names achieved immortality, none have heard or beheld this Way. For the child who possesses this scripture, the Six Palaces of Fengdu will record their name and translocate them to the Southern Pass—how much more so for those who cultivate its practice?

The Lord of Western City stated: This original text comprised three scrolls—*The Heavenly Pass* and *The Heavenly Diagram*—which do not circulate in the world. The Lady of Southern Marchmount received only this single scroll, *The Seven Stars’ Translocation*. Here ends the lower scroll of *The Wondrous Perfection of Highest Clarity: The Three Heaven-Opening Diagrams and the Seven Stars’ Translocation*.

chunks.original_text: 洞真上清开天三图七星移度经 经名：洞真上清天关．三图七星移度经。 撰人不详，约出於东晋。 系早期上清派重要经典。 原本一卷，徒分作二卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 洞真上清开天三图七星移度经卷上 移死度生保仙上法 天关者，是九天之生门也，治在九天东南角，一名天图，一名天关，故为三关也。 众真之所经，神仙之所历，学者之所由也。 其去金阙五千里，玉清上宫七千里，得披三关，便得上登金阙，游宴玉清也。 第一天关，上有九层玉台，台去地一千二百丈，下有长蛇数千，飞龙毒兽备守玉关，巨士三千人，皆备交金之领奋牡门端。 太虚玉晨监，字虚上明，处在玉台之上，飞云流霞，夹映其房，日月玄照，光洞玉清，侍者真仙三百人，主上仙出入，开关之所由。 第二天关，上有六层玉台，高九百丈。 下有长蛇数千，飞龙毒兽备守玉关，巨士三千人，皆备交金之领，夹门两端。 太上监真玉郎，字朗伯，镇在玉台之上，丹云紫盖郁其房，玄光日月映其间，侍者真仙三百人，主监众真游宴之所经。 第三天关，上有三层玉台，高六百丈，下有长蛇数千，飞龙毒兽备守玉关，巨士三千人，皆备交金之领，夹卫两端。 太帝监真玉司郎，字天常生，镇在玉台之上，玄云盖其上，虚烟馥其庭，自明之光焕其形，侍者真仙三百人，主上天众真、地下众生，簿录简籍所关由。 凡受投金简玉名之道，当修披天关关之法。 常当朝夕入室烧香，叩齿十二通，东向心拜四方，存思见九天之端，三关之下，见形状分明历历然。 都尽，次存七星在天之上，随运而转，我身在天关星上，七星运我身，至天关玉台之下，便投玉札一枚，奏名太虚玉晨监自通，见玉晨监以札记着玉格之上，通我身至天关之下。 次存我身还七星之上，七星运我至天关玉台之下，便投玉札一枚，奏太帝监真玉郎前自通，见监真玉郎以札记着玉格之上，通我身至天关之下。 次存我身还七星之上，七星运我至天关玉台之下，便投玉札一枚，奏太帝监真玉司郎前自通，见监真玉司郎以札记着玉格之上，通我身至金阙之下玉清之宫。 次存失去七星，身在空玄之上，溟涬之中，无所倚见。 须臾，觉在金阙玉京金融门之上，投金札一枚，见四极真人以玉案承札，入奏金阙帝君前。 四极真人报，与我俱登玉清之上。 次存玉清之上，四极溟然无崖，唯见青炁郁郁，仰亦无天，俛亦无地，唯见中央有金门四达，内有琼官玉树，金枝夹生两边，巨龙走兽游戏其巅。 存我周游其间，良久，觉如睡眠，已还寝状，身中觉恍恍惚惚、如体蹈空。 存游洞然，都毕，便叩齿＝一十六通，仰天咒曰： 三华宝曜，玉都开明，玄晖敷陈，映监无形，金简录字、克奏玉名，朗睹九天，上戏三清，天关三图，回登紫庭，金阙受号，东华记生，得乘八景，骖御飞耕。 毕，咽炁九过止。 凡学之人，而不知披天之关，奏简记名之道，万亦无成也。 三关总统诸天诸地上真飞仙，及始学簿录，莫不经於三关者也。 凡积学之徒，能使九天三关有玉名，三关玉晨奏於太上太帝之宫，帝君自当遣玉童、玉女各十二人，营卫子身。 此太帝之上篇，以传天帝君，天帝君以传南极上元君，南极上元君以传太微天帝君，太微天帝君以传金阙帝，君，金阙帝君以付上相青童君，使教后学应为真人者。

**The Wondrous Perfection Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Celestial Diagrams and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny**

**Scripture Title:** *The Wondrous Perfection Highest Clarity Scripture of the Heavenly Pass, Three Diagrams, and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Highest Clarity tradition. Originally one scroll, later divided into two. Source text: *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

**The Wondrous Perfection Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Celestial Diagrams and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny, Volume One**

**The Supreme Method for Transcending Death, Preserving Life, and Securing Immortality**

The Heavenly Pass is the Gate of Life of the Nine Heavens, governing the southeast corner of the Nine Heavens. It is also called the Celestial Diagram or the Heavenly Pass, hence the Three Passes. It is the path traversed by the host of perfected beings, the course tread by divine immortals, and the way by which scholars ascend. It lies five thousand *li* from the Golden Portal and seven thousand *li* from the Upper Palace of Jade Clarity. Once one has passed through the Three Passes, one may ascend to the Golden Portal and wander in the feasts of Jade Clarity.

The First Heavenly Pass stands atop a nine-tiered jade terrace, rising twelve hundred *zhang* above the earth. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass, while three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand vigil at the gates. The Jade Dawn Overseer of the Great Void, whose name is Void Supreme Clarity, resides upon the jade terrace. Flying clouds and flowing auroras flank his chamber, while the mysterious radiance of sun and moon illumines Jade Clarity. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, presiding over the entry and exit of ascending immortals and the opening of the pass.

The Second Heavenly Pass stands atop a six-tiered jade terrace, nine hundred *zhang* in height. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass, while three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand guard at either side of the gate. The Supreme Overseer of Perfected Jade, whose name is Bright Elder, is enthroned upon the jade terrace. Crimson clouds and purple canopies shroud his chamber, while the mysterious light of sun and moon shines between them. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, overseeing the passage of the host of perfected beings as they wander and feast.

The Third Heavenly Pass stands atop a three-tiered jade terrace, six hundred *zhang* in height. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass, while three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand guard at either side. The Supreme Emperor’s Overseer of Perfected Jade, whose name is Heavenly Eternal Life, is enthroned upon the jade terrace. Dark clouds veil its summit, while ethereal mists perfume its courtyard. A light of self-illumination gleams upon his form. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, presiding over the celestial host of perfected beings, the earthly multitude of living beings, and the registers and records that govern their passage.

Those who receive the Dao of inscribing their names upon golden tablets and jade slips must cultivate the method of passing through the Heavenly Pass. At dawn and dusk, one should enter the chamber, burn incense, and strike the teeth twelve times. Facing east, bow in reverence to the four directions, and visualize the boundary of the Nine Heavens, clearly perceiving the Three Passes below in vivid detail. When the vision is complete, next visualize the Seven Stars above the heavens, revolving with the celestial motion. Envision your body upon the stars of the Heavenly Pass, the Seven Stars carrying you to the base of the jade terrace of the Heavenly Pass. There, present a jade slip and announce your name to the Jade Dawn Overseer of the Great Void. See the overseer inscribe your name upon the jade register, permitting your passage to the base of the Heavenly Pass.

Next, visualize your body returning to the Seven Stars, which carry you to the base of the jade terrace of the Heavenly Pass. Present another jade slip and announce your name before the Supreme Overseer of Perfected Jade. See the overseer inscribe your name upon the jade register, permitting your passage to the base of the Heavenly Pass.

Then, visualize your body returning once more to the Seven Stars, which carry you to the base of the jade terrace of the Heavenly Pass. Present another jade slip and announce your name before the Supreme Emperor’s Overseer of Perfected Jade. See the overseer inscribe your name upon the jade register, permitting your passage to the Golden Portal beneath the Palace of Jade Clarity.

Next, visualize the Seven Stars receding, your body suspended in the Void of Emptiness, adrift in the primordial chaos, with nothing to rely upon or perceive. After a moment, you will find yourself above the Golden Gate of the Golden Portal and Jade Capital. Present a golden slip, and see the Four Pole Perfected Ones receive it upon a jade table, entering to announce it before the Lord Emperor of the Golden Portal. The Four Pole Perfected Ones will report and ascend with you to the summit of Jade Clarity.

Next, visualize the summit of Jade Clarity, where the Four Poles stretch boundlessly, with only verdant *qi* billowing thickly. Above, there is no heaven; below, no earth. Only at the center do four golden gates open in all directions, within which stand palaces of jasper and jade trees, golden branches flourishing on either side. Mighty dragons and beasts roam and play upon their peaks. Envision yourself wandering among them for a long while, until you feel as though awakening from sleep, your body returning to its resting state. Within, you will feel a vague, ethereal sensation, as though treading upon emptiness. When the vision of your journey is complete, strike the teeth sixteen times and recite the incantation while gazing upward:

*"The Three Flowers’ precious radiance,
The Jade Capital opens in clarity.
Mysterious splendor unfolds,
Illumining the formless overseer.
Golden tablets record the script,
Inscribing names upon jade.
Brightly beholding the Nine Heavens,
Ascending to sport in the Three Clarities.
The Three Diagrams of the Heavenly Pass,
Returning to ascend the Purple Court.
Receiving titles in the Golden Portal,
Eastern Florescence records life.
Attaining the Eight Effulgences,
Driving the flying plow."*

When finished, swallow the *qi* nine times and cease.

Those who study the Dao yet do not know the method of passing through the Heavenly Pass or the way of presenting tablets and inscribing names will never achieve success. The Three Passes govern all the heavens and earths, the flying immortals, and the registers of beginning scholars—none may bypass the Three Passes.

If a diligent student of the Dao can ensure their jade name is recorded in the Nine Heavens and the Three Passes, and that the Jade Dawn of the Three Passes presents it to the Palace of the Supreme and the Supreme Emperor, then the Lord Emperor will dispatch twelve jade lads and twelve jade maidens to attend and protect them.

This is the Supreme Emperor’s Upper Scripture, transmitted to the Lord Emperor of Heaven. The Lord Emperor of Heaven transmitted it to the Supreme Primordial Lord of the Southern Pole, who transmitted it to the Lord Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity. The Lord Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity transmitted it to the Lord Emperor of the Golden Portal, who entrusted it to the Prime Minister, the Azure Lad, to teach future scholars destined to become perfected beings.

chunks.original_text: 金阙圣君曰：天关之道，易披而难明，移度七元，难见而易行，离合二象，生死之源。 人之受炁，而有十三生，命之应终，而归十三死。 故天关为离合之纽，七元为生死之根。 修行高尚，求仙念真，而不知闭死炁於鬼户，度生炁於人门，回七星於东北，披天关於西南，亦不兔於不死，希真亦甚难。 若有金名东华，绿字上清，得见此道，则不死之根，行之七年，位掌名仙，飞舆绿軿，绛子之身，上登玄宫。 上相青童君曰：旋玑运乎天地，玄斗御於八门，流光映於九霄，天威振於十方，列玄象於天图，总生死於七元，固五离以镇死，采六合以自防。 若能乘高真以求度，闭死户於天关，服九精以内照，存玄斗以微芒，克致飞霞之舆，三素之云，腾空驾虚，上造霄晨。 凡修七星移度之道，上招玉皇九君，玄精内照，断塞死根，当寂心幽房，不关风尘，独立对景，盻观霄晨，烧香左右，散烟霞庭，精心苦念，是日勿眠。 如此七年，则致琼舆飞盖丹辕，来迎兆身，上登天关，塞死路於东北，记仙录於南仙，所谓难希之道，易降之真者也。 夫有金格玉名，得披此道。 当以壬寅、丙寅、甲子、甲午、辛未、辛丑，此是天之六会日，高上值合之时也。 玉帝常以其日，使侍仙玉郎校定东华青宫金格玉名，学仙之录。 是其日，有勤志上彻，感启玉皇者，即命北帝酆都六宫断绝死录之根，记生录於人门，移七星加於鬼门，度玄枢，披天关。 每当清斋，苦念注玄，暝目内存，叩齿三十六通，思天第一太皇玄枢阳明天枢魂神上玄九君，衣飞云锦裙，头建玄晨之冠，从玄斗中，下入我身中，因咒曰： 玄枢阳明天枢魂神上真九君，混合变化，共为一神，愿为我断死路於鬼户，度生录於南轩，除七玄於三涂，受胎生而更仙，回七精以玄荫，度我形於天关。 毕，咽炁二七过。 修行不懈，上招玉皇之宾，帝降紫霞之云衢，以西华玉女、　金晨玉童各十二人，侍卫子身。 次思第二元星北胎阴精天璇魂神上玉九君，同着黄锦飞裙，玄晨之冠，从玄斗中，下降入我身，咽炁咒曰： 北胎阴精天璇魂神上玉九君，混合万变，共为一神，愿为我削阳罪於太阴，度阴炁於太阳，移七元以断死，披六合於天关，拔七祖於三涂，更受胎於南轩。 毕，咽炁二七过。 次思第三真星九极上真上元夫人天玑魄精上素九君，同着青锦飞裙，玄晨之冠，从玄斗中，下降入我身，咽炁咒曰： 九极上真上元夫人天玑魄精上素九君，混合变化，共为一神，愿为我披解宿对之根，断绝死道之源，令我目明彻视，洞监无穷，玄真仰注，精灌我身，上攀皇魁，飞步七元，驾景乘空，与天相倾。 毕，便咽炁二七过。 次思第四纽星璇玑玄冥天权魂精上虚九君，同着紫锦飞裙，玄晨之冠，从玄斗中，下降入我身中，便咒曰： 璇玑玄冥天权魂精上虚九君，混合万变，共为一神，愿为我移度七星，填塞鬼门，断截死炁，披朗天关，回北斗於玄枢，度生炁於西坤，离北帝於酆都，得记名於南轩。 毕，咽炁二七过。 次思第五纲星天平丹元玉衡魂台上玄九皇君，同着丹锦飞裙，玄晨之冠，从玄斗中，下来入我身，便咒曰： 天平丹元玉衡魂灵上玄元九皇君，混合万变，共为一神，为我上降七精，下注我身，回四转三，豁落七元，塞死户於东北，受生宫於九玄，记名东华，得侍玉晨。

The Golden Portal Sage Lord states: The Dao of the Heavenly Pass is easy to unfold yet difficult to comprehend; the transference of the Seven Primes is hard to perceive yet easy to practice. The separation and union of the Two Symbols are the source of life and death. Humans receive qi and possess thirteen modes of life; when fate reaches its end, they return to thirteen modes of death. Thus, the Heavenly Pass serves as the pivot of separation and union, while the Seven Primes are the root of life and death. Those who cultivate lofty practices and seek immortality with sincere devotion, yet do not know how to seal the death-qi at the Ghost Gate, transfer the life-qi through the Human Gate, revolve the Seven Stars to the northeast, or unfold the Heavenly Pass to the southwest, shall not escape mortality—attaining Perfection will be exceedingly difficult. If one bears a golden name in the Eastern Florescence and a jade title in the Upper Clarity, having beheld this Dao, then the root of deathlessness shall be established. Practicing this for seven years, one shall hold the rank of a named immortal, ascend in a flying carriage of emerald shafts, the body of a cinnabar youth, and mount the Mysterious Palace.

The Most Exalted Minister, the Azure Lad Lord, states: The turning mechanism revolves through Heaven and Earth, the Mysterious Dipper governs the Eight Gates, its flowing radiance illumines the Nine Empyreans, the celestial might shakes the Ten Directions. The celestial patterns are arrayed upon the Heavenly Chart, life and death are encompassed within the Seven Primes. The Five Separations are firmly established to suppress death, while the Six Harmonies are gathered for self-protection. If one can ride the High Perfected to seek deliverance, seal the Ghost Gate at the Heavenly Pass, ingest the Nine Essences to inwardly illuminate, and visualize the Mysterious Dipper’s subtle glow, one shall summon the flying carriage of cinnabar mist and the clouds of the Three Pure Ones, soaring through the void to ascend to the Empyrean Dawn. Those who cultivate the Dao of transposing the Seven Stars shall summon the Nine Lords of the Jade Emperor; with the inner illumination of Mysterious Essence, they sever the root of death. One must dwell in a secluded chamber with a tranquil mind, undisturbed by worldly dust, standing alone to face the light, gazing upon the Empyrean Dawn. Burn incense to left and right, diffuse mist in the courtyard of rosy clouds, concentrate the mind with earnest devotion, and remain awake on this day. After seven years of such practice, the jade carriage with its flying canopy and cinnabar shafts shall descend to welcome the adept’s body, ascending through the Heavenly Pass to seal the path of death in the northeast and inscribe the immortal’s name in the Southern Transcendence—this is the Dao most difficult to attain, yet the Perfected most readily descend.

Those who possess a golden register and jade name may unfold this Dao. One should choose the days of the Six Celestial Convergences: *renyin*, *bingyin*, *jiazi*, *jiawu*, *xinwei*, and *xinchou*, for these are the times when the Most High aligns with the harmonious moments. On these days, the Jade Emperor routinely dispatches the Jade Lads of the Attendant Immortals to review and confirm the golden registers and jade names of the Eastern Florescence and Azure Palace, recording those who study the immortal’s path. On such days, if one’s diligent aspiration ascends to move the Jade Emperor, he shall command the Northern Emperor of Fengdu’s Six Palaces to sever the root of death’s register, inscribe the record of life at the Human Gate, transpose the Seven Stars to the Ghost Gate, transfer the Mysterious Pivot, and unfold the Heavenly Pass.

Whenever practicing purification and fasting, one must earnestly visualize and focus inwardly. Close the eyes and internally store the vision, then knock the teeth thirty-six times. Visualize the First Celestial Star, the Supreme August Mysterious Pivot of Yang Brightness, the Celestial Pivot Hun Spirit, the Nine Lords of the Upper Mysterious, clad in flying cloud brocade skirts, crowned with the coronet of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Then recite the incantation:

*"Supreme August Mysterious Pivot of Yang Brightness, Celestial Pivot Hun Spirit, Nine Perfected Lords of the Upper Mysterious, blending and transforming as one spirit—may you sever my path of death at the Ghost Gate, transfer the record of life to the Southern Pavilion, remove the Seven Mysteries from the Three Paths, and rebirth me to become an immortal. Revolve the Seven Essences to grant me mysterious shade, and deliver my form through the Heavenly Pass."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Second Primordial Star, the Northern Womb Yin Essence, the Celestial Chariot Hun Spirit, the Nine Jade Lords of the Upper Mystery, all clad in yellow brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Swallow qi and recite the incantation:

*"Northern Womb Yin Essence, Celestial Chariot Hun Spirit, Nine Jade Lords of the Upper Mystery, blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you erase my yang transgressions in the Great Yin, transfer yin qi to the Great Yang, transpose the Seven Primes to sever death, and unfold the Six Harmonies at the Heavenly Pass. Deliver my seven ancestors from the Three Paths, and grant me rebirth in the Southern Pavilion."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Third True Star, the Nine Ultimates of the Upper Perfected, the Lady of the Upper Primordial, the Celestial Mechanism Po Essence, the Nine Pure Lords of the Upper Simplicity, all clad in azure brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Swallow qi and recite the incantation:

*"Nine Ultimates of the Upper Perfected, Lady of the Upper Primordial, Celestial Mechanism Po Essence, Nine Pure Lords of the Upper Simplicity, blending and transforming as one spirit—may you unfold and dissolve the roots of karmic opposition, sever the source of the deathly path. Grant me eyes that see clearly and penetrate the boundless, with Mysterious Perfection pouring down and essence irrigating my body. May I grasp the August Chief Star, tread the Seven Primes, ride the luminous void, and soar alongside Heaven."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Fourth Pivot Star, the Mysterious Mechanism of Profound Darkness, the Celestial Balance Hun Essence, the Nine Void Lords of the Upper Mystery, all clad in purple brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Recite the incantation:

*"Mysterious Mechanism of Profound Darkness, Celestial Balance Hun Essence, Nine Void Lords of the Upper Mystery, blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you transpose the Seven Stars, fill and seal the Ghost Gate, sever the death-qi, and unfold the radiant Heavenly Pass. Revolve the Northern Dipper at the Mysterious Pivot, transfer the life-qi to the Western Kun, depart from the Northern Emperor of Fengdu, and inscribe my name in the Southern Pavilion."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times.

Next, visualize the Fifth Principal Star, the Celestial Balance of Cinnabar Origin, the Jade Balance Hun Terrace, the Nine August Lords of the Upper Mystery, all clad in cinnabar brocade flying skirts and coronets of the Mysterious Dawn, descending from the Mysterious Dipper into one’s body. Recite the incantation:

*"Celestial Balance of Cinnabar Origin, Jade Balance Hun Spirit, Nine August Lords of the Upper Mystery, blending myriad transformations as one spirit—may you descend the Seven Essences upon me, pour them into my body, revolve the Four to become Three, and activate the Seven Primes. Seal the Ghost Gate in the northeast, receive the life palace of the Nine Mysteries, inscribe my name in the Eastern Florescence, and allow me to serve the Jade Dawn."*

Afterward, swallow qi fourteen times. With unwavering practice, one shall summon the guests of the Jade Emperor. The Emperor shall descend upon a thoroughfare of purple clouds, accompanied by twelve Western Florescence Jade Maidens and twelve Golden Dawn Jade Lads to attend and guard the adept’s body.

Clad in cinnabar brocade flying gauze skirts and crowned with the Dark Dawn’s coronet, they descend from the Dark Dipper into one’s body. Recite the incantation:

Merge the Nine Yin, revolve the Celestial Gate, and release my Seven Mysteries’ ancestors. Together, they ride clouds of green mist to welcome the adept’s body, ascending into the midst of the Seven Stars.

Practicing this for seven years and bearing the Seven Primes’ Barrier-Opening will summon green-mist chariots to welcome the adept’s body. *The Upper Scroll of the* Wondrous True Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Charts of Opening Heaven and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny *#1: "Celestial Barrier" (originally miswritten as "Opening Heaven").*

*The Lower Scroll of the* Wondrous True Highest Clarity Scripture of the Three Charts of Opening Heaven and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny.

According to the *Scripture of the Four Poles’ Luminous Regulations*, these talismans emerge once every seven hundred years. The method of transmission requires the disciple to observe a seven-day fast, offering thirty-one feet of blue-threaded silk, seventy feet of blue silk, ninety feet of phoenix-patterned gauze, seven pairs of gold buttons, one pair each of gold fish and jade dragons as tokens of the oath. Sages value the Dao and disdain wealth, thus transmitting it only with tokens. Those who vex over wealth while seeking the Dao will find the Dao ever distant. Even if one glimpses the treasure text amid such leaks, the body will perish among the ghost officials, calamity extending to the Seven Mysteries—no benefit shall arise from such attainment.

If one possesses sincere devotion, an empty and earnest heart, and petitions the Jade Emperor to inscribe their name in the Eastern Florescence, dwelling in secluded peaks and distancing oneself from the human realm, sacrificing one’s own clothing and sustenance—only then may the scripture be transmitted.

Scholars who study yet remain ignorant of Heaven’s Celestial Barrier and Earth’s Fengdu—where the Barrier governs spirits and Fengdu commands ghosts—fail to grasp that these two Emperors preside over life and death, bound by the Dipper’s pivotal mechanism. Thus, the Seven Stars’ transference severs the Six Palaces’ names, while the Celestial Barrier records the register of immortals. The Dark Dipper corresponds to the Flourishing Canopy, and the Seven Primes bestow the Barrier-Opening. The path to immortality lies near at hand.

**The August Lord’s Inner Illumination with the Bright Lamp: Supreme Method for Seeking Immortality**
*Transmitted by the Southern Culmen Supreme Primordial Lord*

The August Lord constantly dwells in the Tower of Radiant Mystery, within golden chambers and purple doors. He illumines himself with the Bright Mystery Lamp, suffusing the eight windows with rosy light. He contemplates the Supreme Perfected within the Five Forms and unfolds the Three Vows in the August Chamber. Yet this wondrous method of the Supreme Perfected and the Pure is not transmitted to the lower world. Only those with golden names, jade characters, and a mysterious register may receive this Dao. Practicing it for nine years, your body will become luminous, seeing clearly for ten thousand miles. The Mysterious Vision will arise naturally, and the Night-Light Lads will descend to your chamber, bestowing upon you the True Writ. You will ascend in broad daylight to the Dawn.

Eight paths radiant and bright.
Serene in spirit within the secluded chamber,
Gazing upward to leap into the Supreme Clarity.
Five glories emanate from the Mysterious Terrace,
Jade mushrooms grow naturally.
Penetrating illumination reaches the Supreme Perfected,

Eradicating the qi of the Nine Yin,
Inscribing my name in the Eastern Florescence.
Preserving me without end,
Forever paralleling the sun and moon.
Delivering me from the Seven Dark Perils,
Receiving further glory in the Southern Palace.
The Bright Light awakens the Jade Thearch,

Heaven sends the Flying Rosy Chariot,
Soaring through the sky in a green carriage.
I attain audience in the Thearch’s hall,

When finished, bow twice, face your Original Destiny, raise your head, and swallow saliva seven times.

Inner vision radiant, empty and unified.
Unfastening the luminous sash of the spirit,

Returning to an infant’s countenance.
Bestowing upon me the Maiden of the Western Florescence,
Assigning me the Golden Dawn Lad.
Attending to incense and treading upon my years,
Bowing my head in the Jade Thearch’s chamber.
Spirits at peace, the Dao flows smoothly,
Fear dispelled amidst the fragrant smoke.
Composing my heart to abide in the Supreme Mystery,
Earnestly moved by the cavernous void.
The chamber summons the descent of Divine Rosy Clouds,
Closing my eyes to gaze upon the Immortal Lords.
Delivering my seven generations of ancestors from peril,
Transforming my form to return to the Southern Palace.*

When finished, bow twice, face east, and swallow qi fourteen times.

Constantly keep the Bright Lamp at the Grand Year to commune with the spirits and fulfill vows in seeking the True. After three years, the Mysterious Light will inwardly crystallize, and the Divine Perfected will descend, bestowing upon you the method of immortality. At that time, there will naturally be a response. Morning and evening, burn incense, strike the teeth twelve times, face the lamp, and recite the incantation:

*The lamp’s flame illumines the Supreme Perfected,
Bright light penetrating the Mysterious Void.
Unfolding the supreme and lofty Dao,
My heart fixed upon the Jade Thearch’s abode.
Penetrating the empty and cavernous within,
The spirit’s vision expands the body’s ease.
Accumulated sincerity draws the numinous descent,
A tranquil heart governs the hidden dwelling.
Morning rites in the Thearch’s hall,
Evening recitations of the True Writ.
Carefree within the Mysterious Capital,
For ten thousand years reverting to infancy.
A heavenly crown of purple rosy clouds,
The Thearch assigns six jade chariots.
Wandering atop the Five Peaks,
Contentment found wherever I go.
Seven generations of ancestors escape the Three Wretched Paths,
Blessings and felicity overflowing.*

When finished, bow twice and swallow qi fourteen times.

If you can constantly keep the Bright Lamps lit in these three places without extinguishing them, your seven generations of ancestors will immediately escape the Ten Sufferings, ascending to the Southern Culmen. Your body’s spirits will become serene and upright, your eyes seeing for ten thousand miles, your ears hearing distant sounds, and your heart’s wisdom foreseeing the yet-unrealized. The Divine Perfected will descend, and the Night-Light Lads will teach you the Way of seeking immortality. After nine years of this, the numinous light will naturally become bright, penetrating within and without.

chunks.original_text: 故有感而致真，真亦感发而降焉。 是其日，常沐浴清斋，入室烧香，心拜四方，正东向平坐，东向者，是当阳始晖之方也。 叩齿三十六通。 第一上愿我生自然之炁，炁中结成我身，身与三光齐伦，长享无极之根； 二愿我身常处太空之上，琼宫玉房之裹，朝与玉帝同宴，夕与玄母同止，渴嗡浪井洪泉玉芝，饥纳龙胎琼腴绛树赤子； 三愿我身生万瑞七十二光，奇毛异骨，飞羽衣裳，乘虚驾空，出入帝宫，众庆来臻，万寿无量； 四愿与无俱生，与无俱死，死而又生，生为真皇，封掌十天，总领群仙； 五愿一切众生，已生未生，同保日月三光，有道之人七玄之祖，上升南宫，天下之福，靡有不当。 四方五愿，并会玉堂。 次上愿九玄扶养我身，魂魄真神常居我宫，上通天仙，下逮洞渊，愿天、愿地、愿风、愿神、愿仙，五愿一合，定籍长生，天降紫烟，地卫五灵，乘云驾虚，飞辇绿軿，上造金阙，进登玉清，庆及七祖，更受胎生，五愿五合，长享利贞。 中愿亦五，得道本根，愿阴、愿阳、愿太空、愿太无、愿太玄，上宴玉房，与帝因缘，游盼生关，披浪九天，元父定籍，玄母记年，桃康结精，保固丹田，身腾金阙，名书玉篇，七祖解脱，福庆来臻。 下愿亦五，愿太虚、愿太有、愿太上、愿太真、愿神仙，运身於五岳之岭，飘飖九霄之际，出入开关之裹，移脱死户之外，愿天地为我父母，三光卫我万年，神守九源之孔，灵降自然之炁，八方五愿，与响而会。 五愿毕，叩齿二七通，咒曰： 太帝上元，帝一玄经，五云散景，郁郁三清，玉童玉女，烧香侍灵，上愿开陈，与我合形，使我神仙，上升帝庭，北帝落死，南斗注生，东华金阁，得上我名，无穷之愿，与我齐并。 咒毕，又叩齿三七过，仰咽炁五通止。 此帝君开陈上愿，与灵合形之道也。 常能尔者，则玉华侍卫，玉童散香，上彻九天，感应帝皇，五年如此，道自降矣。 天下十方有道之愿，道无不降子之情。 口愿之际，当令心意在一，不得他念外想，真神散越，则愿不降也。 履淹冒秽，真亦远也。 帝君上愿五会之道，毕於此也。 每至其日，若能精心愿念如法，帝遣玉童卫子之身，招致五方之愿，神仙之道来降尔形。 如此五年，克乘飞云，上升九天，列名东华，七祖父母亦荷福庆，得去三涂，受仙南宫也。 南极上元君曰：世人之学，唯知朝求而暮获，一念而希降，吐咒而望应，而不知登栖岐之岭，起於山迹，千丈之木，出於毫末，道高而真妙，岂可发足而望登於云梯耶。 帝君受炁而掌真，犹尚明灯以自通，五愿以希庆，岂不能包於自然也。 夫求仙之道，皆当先愿而后求，愿感而致灵尔。 五愿之大也，愿亦无所不包，福亦无所不覆，庆亦无所不流，可谓触愿善矣。 若能精心在愿，愿亦无不响应，后来有情者，为复访而意焉。 上相青童君曰：吾往学经历七百年，涉峻登巅，越东跨西，殊南经北，逍遥中原，经师三十二人，凡受三百余事，未得上登金阙，诣圣君受灵书紫文，服日月黄华拘魂制魄之道，结璘郁仪，九真八道解形遁变，紫度炎光流金火铃，吐纳飞霞腾空步云，蹑行七元宝经。 圣君以七星移度，太帝所宝，告盟见授，使断落六宫死名，填塞东北鬼户，上开天关移度我身，然后可得上登三元奉行，遂得上相之司，总领群仙，七星焕落於天，回转九元之精，上乘三元之炁，下统六天之名，生死离合，莫不由於七星。

Thus, through sincere devotion, the Perfected are summoned, and the Perfected, moved by such devotion, descend. On these days, one must bathe in purity and fast, enter the chamber to burn incense, bow in reverence to the four directions, then sit upright facing east—for east is the direction of the dawning radiance. Knock the teeth thirty-six times in succession.

The First Vow: May the qi of my birth be natural, coalescing within it to form my body, my body equal in rank to the Three Luminaries, eternally rooted in the boundless.
The Second Vow: May my body ever dwell above the Great Void, within the Jade Palace and chambers of jade, feasting with the Jade Emperor by day and abiding with the Mysterious Mother by night; when thirsty, sipping from the Wave-Well’s vast spring and jade mushrooms, when hungry, partaking of dragon embryos, jade-rich fat, crimson trees, and red infants.
The Third Vow: May my body generate ten thousand auspicious signs and seventy-two rays of light, with rare hairs and extraordinary bones, clad in feathered robes, riding the void and driving through the sky, entering and exiting the imperial palace, with all blessings converging, and boundless longevity.
The Fourth Vow: May I be born with the formless and die with the formless, dying yet living again, reborn as a Perfected Sovereign, governing the Ten Heavens and leading the host of immortals.
The Fifth Vow: May all sentient beings, born or yet unborn, together preserve the Three Luminaries of sun and moon; may those of the Dao and the Seven Mysteries’ ancestors ascend to the Southern Palace, and may the world’s blessings be without exception fulfilled.

The vows of the four directions and the Five Vows converge in the Jade Hall.

Next, the supreme vow: May the Nine Mysteries nurture my body, my hun and po souls and true spirits ever dwell within my palace, ascending to commune with the celestial immortals, descending to reach the abyssal depths. May the vows to Heaven, Earth, Wind, Spirits, and Immortals unite as one, inscribing my name in the register of eternal life. May purple mists descend from Heaven, and may the Five Numinous Ones guard the earth. Riding clouds and driving through the void, ascending in a jade-green chariot, I shall reach the Golden Gate and ascend to the Jade Purity, extending blessings to my seven ancestors, who shall be reborn anew. The Five Vows merge into five unions, eternally enjoying prosperity and harmony.

The Middle Vows, also five in number, seek the root of attaining the Dao: the Vow of Yin, the Vow of Yang, the Vow of the Great Void, the Vow of the Great Nothingness, and the Vow of the Great Mystery. Feasting in the Jade Chambers with the Emperor, bound by karmic affinity, gazing upon the gates of life, traversing the Nine Heavens. The Primordial Father inscribes my name, the Mysterious Mother records my years. Peaches of immortality and radiance coalesce, securing the Cinnabar Field. My body ascends to the Golden Gate, my name inscribed in the Jade Register. My seven ancestors are liberated, and blessings converge.

The Lower Vows, also five in number: the Vow of the Great Void, the Vow of the Great Existence, the Vow of the Supreme, the Vow of the Great Perfected, and the Vow of the Divine Immortals. May I traverse the peaks of the Five Marchmounts, drift among the Nine Skies, enter and exit the gates of opening, and transcend the portals of death. May Heaven and Earth be my parents, the Three Luminaries guard me for ten thousand years. May spirits guard the nine apertures of my body, and numinous qi descend naturally. The Five Vows of the eight directions converge in resonance.

When the Five Vows are complete, knock the teeth fourteen times and recite the incantation:

*"Supreme Emperor of the Upper Origin, the Emperor’s Unity and Mysterious Canon, five clouds scatter radiance, luxuriant in the Three Purities. Jade lads and jade maidens burn incense and attend the numinous. The supreme vows are declared, uniting with my form, making me a divine immortal, ascending to the imperial court. The Northern Emperor severs death, the Southern Dipper inscribes life. In the Eastern Flower’s Golden Pavilion, my name is recorded. Boundless vows align with mine."*

When the incantation is finished, knock the teeth twenty-one times more, then tilt the head back and swallow qi five times before ceasing.

This is the August Lord’s method of declaring the supreme vows to unite with the numinous in form. Those who practice thus shall be attended by jade blossoms and guarded by jade lads who scatter incense, their devotion ascending to the Nine Heavens, moving the Emperor to respond. After five years of such practice, the Dao shall naturally descend. Throughout the world’s ten directions, wherever there are vows of the Dao, the Dao shall not fail to descend in response. When reciting the vows, the mind and intent must be singular, without stray thoughts or external distractions. If the true spirits scatter, the vows shall not descend. If one treads in defilement or impurity, the Perfected shall remain distant.

Here concludes the August Lord’s method of the Five Vows and Ten Assemblies.

On each of these days, if one can recite the vows with focused sincerity and proper method, the Emperor shall dispatch jade lads to guard one’s body, summoning the vows of the five directions and the Dao of divine immortality to descend upon one’s form. After five years of such practice, one shall ride flying clouds to ascend the Nine Heavens, with one’s name recorded in the Eastern Flower. One’s seven ancestors and parents shall also receive blessings, escape the Three Wretched Paths, and be reborn in the Southern Palace of the Immortals.

The Supreme Lord of the Upper Origin of the Southern Culmen states: Those who study in the world know only to seek in the morning and expect results by evening, to utter a single vow and hope for a response, to recite an incantation and await its fulfillment. Yet they do not realize that ascending the peaks of Mount Qi begins with the first step on the mountain path; a tree of a thousand feet grows from a tender shoot. The Dao is lofty and the Perfected are wondrous—how can one set foot and expect to climb the cloud ladder at once? Even the August Lord, who received the qi and governed the Perfected, still relied on the bright lamp to commune with the numinous, and the Five Vows to invoke blessings. How could one not encompass the natural?

The path of seeking immortality must begin with vows before seeking, for vows move the numinous to respond. The greatness of the Five Vows encompasses all, their blessings covering all, their felicity flowing without end—truly, they touch upon all that is good. If one’s heart is sincere in the vows, there shall be no vow that does not resonate in response. May those who come after with devotion take heed.

The Most Exalted Azure Lad states: In my past studies, I traversed seven hundred years, scaling perilous peaks, crossing east and west, journeying south and north, roaming the central plains. I studied under thirty-two masters and received over three hundred teachings, yet I had not ascended to the Golden Gate to receive the sacred texts and purple writings from the Saintly Lord—the Dao of ingesting the yellow essence of sun and moon to restrain the hun and po souls, of coalescing radiance and luminous instruments, of the Nine Perfected and Eight Paths to dissolve form and escape transformation, of the Purple Passage, scorching light, flowing gold, and fire bells, of exhaling and inhaling flying clouds, treading the void, and stepping upon the Seven Primordials’ precious canon. The Saintly Lord, by the Seven Stars’ translocation—a treasure of the Supreme Emperor—swore an oath and transmitted it to me, enabling me to sever the deathly names of the Six Palaces, seal the ghostly gate of the northeast, and open the Heavenly Pass to translocate my body. Only then could I ascend to serve the Three Origins, attaining the office of Most Exalted Minister, governing the host of immortals. The Seven Stars blazed in the heavens, revolving the essence of the Nine Origins. Above, I rode the qi of the Three Origins; below, I governed the names of the Six Heavens. Life and death, separation and union—none were beyond the Seven Stars.
